intro: Margarospermum officinale, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often with a rosette of leaves at the base. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
